title: Quiz 1: Special Health Needs & Disabilities
description: Assessment on managing disabilities, hearing/visual impairments, elderly care, and chronic illnesses.

questions.question: According to the study material, which of the following best defines a 'disability'?

options.text: A temporary loss of function due to accidental injury.
A physical, emotional, or mental injury/illness that is severe or permanent and interferes with normal growth or ability to learn/work.
Any condition that requires hospitalization for more than two weeks.
A congenital defect that solely affects motor functions.

questions.explanation: A disability is defined as a physical, emotional, or mental injury or illness that is severe or permanent, interfering with an individual's normal growth, development, or ability to learn or work.
questions.hint: Think about the permanence and impact on daily functions.

questions.question: Match the type of hearing loss cause to the specific part of the ear it affects:
questions.explanation: Tubal catarrh affects the Middle Ear; Meniere's disease affects the Inner Ear; Acoustic Neuroma is a tumor of the auditory nerve; Impacted wax affects the External Ear.
questions.hint: Consider where the eustachian tube connects versus where nerve impulses are generated.

questions.question: Which of the following are identified as specific needs of the elderly in the community? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Elderly needs include alleviating loneliness, improving nutrition (e.g., meals provided by women/youth groups), and help with chores. They should be integrated, not isolated or forced into institutions.
questions.hint: Think about the social and physical support mentioned in the text.

questions.question: A person who is born completely deaf and has never developed speech is described as ___BLANK___, while a person with defective but serviceable hearing is described as ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Total hearing loss before speech development is termed 'deaf and dumb'. 'Hard of hearing' implies defective but functional hearing.
questions.hint: The first term relates to speechlessness; the second implies some residual function.

questions.question: In Kenya, the elderly are strictly defined as persons aged 55 years and above.
questions.explanation: In Kenya, the elderly are defined as persons aged 64 years and above, although the retirement age is 55 years.
questions.hint: Check the specific age mentioned in the text versus the retirement age.

questions.question: What is the term for the system of reading specially developed for blind people using raised marks?
questions.explanation: Braille is the system of reading used by the visually impaired.

questions.question: Review the list of causes below. Which one is a cause of INNER ear hearing impairment?

richContent.content:
• Acute middle ear infections
  • Tubal catarrh
  • Neonatal jaundice (Kernicterus)
  • Excessive wax

questions.explanation: Neonatal jaundice leading to kernicterus causes brain damage that interferes with sound interpretation, a defect associated with the inner ear/brain connection. The others are middle or external ear issues.
questions.hint: Look for the condition that causes brain damage.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of adaptation to chronic illness in the correct chronological order:
questions.explanation: Patients typically progress from Denial/Disbelief -> Anger/Awareness -> Reorganization/Hope.
questions.hint: It starts with refusing to accept the diagnosis.

questions.question: Which organization is primarily responsible for settling externally displaced persons (refugees) in Kenya?

options.text: ICRC (International Committee of the Red Cross)
UNHCR (United Nations High Commission for Refugees)

questions.explanation: The government works closely with the UNHCR to settle all externally displaced persons. ICRC protects rights of internally displaced people.
questions.hint: This is a UN body focused specifically on refugees.

questions.question: Which of the following are listed as problems encountered by displaced persons?

richContent.content: Scenario: A population has moved due to flooding. Health workers are assessing risks.

questions.explanation: Displaced persons face overcrowding, malnutrition, psychological trauma, poor sanitation, and security risks.
questions.hint: Focus on the negative health and social impacts described in the text.
